bibl.title: Anonymus, Parallel Lines from Homer and Archilochus.
bibl.note: Diplomatic transcript and interpretation of P. Hibeh II, 173 (= Pack2 136). "Our Anonymus compiled his parallels in order to show that Archilochus was guilty of plagiarizing Homer. If the inference is correct, the "klope" literature is at least half a century older than Aristophanes of Byzantium."
bibl.seg: Slings Simon R., Anonymus, Parallel Lines from Homer and Archilochus.

Diplomatic transcript and interpretation of P. Hibeh II, 173 (= Pack2 136). "Our Anonymus compiled his parallels in order to show that Archilochus was guilty of plagiarizing Homer. If the inference is correct, the "klope" literature is at least half a century older than Aristophanes of Byzantium."
